reviews.text: This place makes everyone feel like a kid. You will be amazed my the sheer size of Lawrence Hall. The exhibits are engaging and it is a great place on a rainy day. They also run fun camps for afterschool, in the summer and school holidays. Check out the gift shop really fun science kits to take home. My daughter and always enjoyed this wonderful place.

This place is awesome. To start, you're high on a hill and the view of the bay is spectacular, especially at sunset where it's really mind blowing. The various exhibits on display are usually really cool and lots of times they have interactive displays setup so everyone is very engaged including the kids.

Great place to go. Definitely a must for watching a sunset on a clear night!

The display is small and it costs extra to watch their 3d movie. The way they present science is dry. I was expecting Exploratorium level but it was not even close. We went in for half an hour and left out of boredom. My kids are 2 and 4. Maybe older kids would enjoy it more but really there is not much to do except various wind tunnels. The location is beautiful though. This is just my honest opinion.
Had our son’s 6th birthday here.  Everyone had a blast.
So much fun! Many amazing things to do and sights to see!

Nice beautiful walk by the bay! Animal friendly park and there is an off leash area at the top. It's slightly under a 2 mile walk full circle but it's a nice breezy stroll. 
Parking can be crazy so either plan to get there early or walk a ways to the trail head. It is right near McLaughlin State park so if want to walk more, you can continue on into that park.
Great views. People walking their dogs everywhere. Came here for a picnic and to fly a kite. Grassy knolls and small trails scattered about. Cool area to hangout.

We came across this National Monument by accident on the way to see the Tehachapi Train Loop. We popped in for a quick look, not knowing who Cesar Chavez was. Entrance was FREE. The centre contains an introductory film and then a superb display of photographs telling the story of his fight for better working conditions for farm workers. There was just enough detail in the exhibits. Outside there were lovely gardens, alongside his and his wife's grave. It was definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

Also locally known as Kite Hill, this is a great mixed-use park. Rolling hills and nice paved footpaths give way to stunning views of the Bay and San Francisco. Great for all ages and dogs. They host the kite festival here every spring/summer which is a great event.

Cesar Chavez Park was created by placing landfill over the old city dump. It is next to the Berkeley Yacht Harbor and looks out over the San Francisco Bay. On a clear day, the view is truly one of the prettiest urban settings in the USA. The buildings of San Francisco sparkle from the reflected sunlight. You are directly across from the Golden Gate Bridge's graceful lines. On a clear day you can see the Farallones Islands miles away in the Pacific Ocean by looking under the bridge. Cesar Chavez Park is famous for its late July annual Kite Festival. Kites of all sorts fly into the sky. Even without a kite, during the festival take a walk around the approximate 1 1/4 mile perimeter. It is a special place and can be reached by the 51B bus

If you are looking for somewhere inexpensive to have some lunch then come here as you have plenty to choose from. At this centre you cam buy almost anything from pork to chicken and everything in between and it will just cost under S$10 For a nice meal.
We have pork and duck meat with a pork soup and it was delicious. If you want to try something different then go for the black skin chicken. For drinks you can get anything from water to tea or coffee.
I had so much fun that hippies are so cool I smoke some of the best weed for the best price

A great space and part of Berkeley's story, student accommodation not sure? A refuge and a place of reflection for Berkeley siders, keep People's Park as it is, a moving story and inportant history that should be preserved and improved.

Peoples Park is a precious green space. I play live acoustic music at Peoples Park whenever I get a chance, guitar songs, jazz, funk, folk, rock, samba, bossa nova, percussion... I have old friends there and did community gardening there for five years, growing 13 foot tall corn and green beans, and all kinds of stuff. The trees and plants there are good old friends too. I've heard lots of great bands on the Free Speech Stage, summer concerts, the Berkeley World Music series, drum jams, dancing. Its very interesting, I've learned a lot there, talking to people, about history, people, culture, plants, gardening.

I have always loved this old park.
Sad it is always under attack and it is purposely kept decrepit by the University to justify building on it.
Guess everyone will use Williard Park should the unelected have their way.

The garden has a number of trails - some trails that are an easy walk and some that go up hills and in and around the plants. You could spend quite some time in this garden if you try to go on every trail. The garden has plants from a variety of places, nicely arranged. It also has a vegetable garden which will likely be quite interesting for young kids. In some areas, you get a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. We visited the garden in January with not much blooming and it was still very interesting. I look forward to going back in the spring when the roses and other flowers are in full bloom.

So beautiful! It’s not stroller-friendly throughout but there’s still quite a bit you can see on the accessible paths. Loved the diversity of plant life outside and in the greenhouses and the beauty of the presentation. There are lots of little side trails that go off into the vegetation that I’ll try next time!

This botanical garden is a miniture California in the sense of plants. The whole area is divided into several parts to showcase plants in different climates in the states. This design enables the visitor to step out of the desert and walk right into the tall wood forest. Quite a magical experience especially lead by the volunteer guides.

We love this place! The reciprocal memberships pay for themselves in no time, 150 for two adults and two guests and 
 Four children every time. if you go to their website and look at the list of reciprocal museums listing ; like for the Young, every botanical garden you can think of, omca and so many more. If you like parks and museums this is the card for you. Not to mention you get a discount at many Bay area nurseries! Crazy good deal.

Wandering the leafy paths lined with living curiosities is pure tranquility!
The gardens are replete with birds, newts, ponds, streams, all manner of trees, shrubs, vines, and some grand views with benches for restful contemplation. The very welcoming vibe isn't marred by too much educational structure. Guests are mostly left to themselves, with the option of joining regular guided tours.
Pedro's favorite is the best sandwich ever! Its sweet and savory with a little heat. I never get a chance to take a pic because I eat it so fast 😂😂
Food is great here. They even let you taste a sample.
A long lasting business that serves iconic sandwiches, I love their sandwiches, I love the street food atmosphere, the owner is just a very nice guy, love it

My family and I love this place!! We make special trips from Fremont to get a sandwich from here. Pedro's favorite is definitely my go to. The wife and kids get the regular sandwich but the food is excellent.  At times there can be long lines and you can wait a while for your food but it is a small little shop that takes on a lot of business. He has multiple other locations including a beer garden on shatuck and a sit down indoor location just down the street from from here. This is a must do if you're are in the area!!
Food is good but service could use improvement

I love vegetarian and vegan food, and there are some great options in the East Bay, but this place is mediocre at best. I'm always astounded to see that it's filled with people, because each time I've eaten here I've found that the food lacks flavor. Instead of having a huge selection with sub-par food, they should probably focus on serving a smaller number of dishes that actually taste good.
I love coming here.  It's not perfect, but I always come away very satisfied.  Love the great selection, and service is always friendly.

Food is good.  The shakes are awesome!  The service can be slow.  Other than that, it's worth giving it a try especially if you are a vegetarian or vegan.  Even if you are not, the flavors are good enough that you won't miss the meat.

The food is hearty vegan fare.  I had their homemade ginger ale which was delightful.  For a main dish their lasagna which also came with salad.
The dressing was tasty yet the salad a bit over-dressed and slightly wilted like it sat by the hot food a bit too long.
The lasagna was delish, filling, hearty if a tad saltier than I'm used to.  
All in all, good hearty solid cooked fare.
Great service! Friendly spot to meet up with friends - we hung out there for almost 4 hours and they were so flexible and hospitable with us.

What a pleasant surprise finding this Thai restaurant on Shuttuck. Nice low-keyed jazz was played during dinner and the bench seat was comfortable. The curry was just perfect; not to plain or too hot. The traditional dish of thin noodles, chicken, onions, etc. was delicious. At 4 o'clock it was quiet, just what me and my friend wanted so we could talk conversationally. Good and pleasant service.

Excellent food.  I had the fresh rolls and panang seasonal curry, both of which were great.  I was with people who enjoyed the soups, great broth, noodles, and lots of vegetables. 

Very good service.

Kid friendly. 

Cash only and no ATM.  Thankfully there are lots of banks nearby.

Amazing place. The dry noodles are amazing. Don't remember the name of the dish but, I got this with tofu. Tofu was grilled and not deep fried. Prices are very good. $10 for most entrees, thai tea was delicious.  Area was nice, plenty of variety, fast/great service. Great if you are vegetarian, you can substitute with different meats including seafood and tofu. Not from the area but definitely coming again!
Excellent Thai food. Best I've had outside of Thailand. So delicious.

I discovered this place by mistake. I'm glad it was a mistake because I love it now. Everytime I have to go to downtime Berkeley, I take the effort to walk the few blocks from bart just to have lunch there. I always get the pad Thai, one of the best I had. The room is quiet, the waitress/owner (I think) is friendly, warm and always with a smile. You can talk to her, she's super relax and pleasant. I LOVE this place!

Overall a very nice place. The ham and cheese croissant that I ate was very tasty, so good that I forgot all about the price which seemed high at first. They have seats on the main floor, an upstairs area as well as outdoor seating. Good mix of young and old people here. Lots of pastries and drinks but the main food selection is a bit limited. They do have a pasta of the day.

Had the vanilla orange organic tea. It is a wonderful blend. Also great if you like to add soy milk to your tea. Can't beat the price either, with free resteep if desired. Pastries are great as well. Didn't try the food. Selection looked good but a little pricey. Overall great place, great customer service, and plenty of tables. Please tap the thumbs up icon below if this review helped thank you.

The best croissant around. I regularly stopped by this place before the remodel, with the new setup the place is absolutely gorgeous. There is a crazy beautiful table right next to the kitchen, check that table out if you stop by. Say hi to the birds

Newly expanded, menu selection simple and very well done. Staff helpful. The upstairs had many people on laptops while downstairs was more conversation. The breads and rolls outstanding. I had sandwich  with heirloom tomatoes and provolone and it was excellent. Good place for a simple but satisfying lunch.
Loved this place...very friendly..ND food was delicious..

Lovely place with really good food and extremely reasonable prices. I always get the pad see ewe and it's great!  They have vegetarian options too! One thing to be careful about is that they are cash only, but there is an ATM nearby I think in Asian Ghetto. Or there is a Bank of America ATM down the street on telegraph. Definitely recommend this place if you want food or anything.

The best Thai place in Berkeley! CASH ONLY, which is annoying but worth it to get their amazing food. The Pad See Ew is the star with good flavor texture and portion, but their curries and soups are also very good. The prices are not bad and the wait can take a little time but is worth. There is good amount of indoor and outdoor seating, and overall is a must try place in Berkeley!

Good Thai food that is very cheap and convenient. Very good place to go eat if you're looking for a quick, good meal. There are definitely better Thai places around Berkeley, but this place is still worth eating at.
I love the eggplant basil chicken dish here. In my opinion it is by far the best dish there, and is maybe even my favorite dish in all of Berkeley! I highly recommend it.

Spiciest food that I've had at Berkeley. As an Indian, even other Indian restaurants cannot match the spiciness of the motherland. Thankfully, Thai Basil can help me remember what it feels to taste food. Definitely go here if you want spicy Thai food.
They have mild options as well if you don't like spicy food.
Great frozen yogurt with terrific flavors and smiling service staff. We encounter a line but it moved quickly.  My chocolate and vanilla swirl was memorable.

The ABSOLUTE BEST frozen yogurt hands down! With all the big chain tart froyo joints taking over, it’s hard to find excellent old fashion frozen yogurt - but this is the place! Hometown/small shop/Berkeley vibe, large portions, and delicious flavors make this place a must frequent.

This place is beautiful and so are the people who work here. After a long day I appreciate this building’s cold softserve more than I do my own two parents. Bless this ice cream dispensary from the heavens.

This is the best Yogurt experience in California. The yogurt was excellent , the employees were friendly, and they put toppings in layers in the cup. This establishment is the light at the end of the tunnle that makes life worth living.

Super yummy frozen yogurt for amazing prices. Staff is super friendly, and you can sample all the flavors before deciding. Open super late too, so great for a sweet late night snack. Fits the definition of a hole in the wall location perfectly.

Amazing burgers, cooked to perfection.  Their Green Flash IPA on tap us my go to beer.  Their fries are amazing and one of the few places that offer steak cut fries (and get that fresh garlic on it).  Anytime I'm on Solano and need a good burger, i look no further.  Always friendly staff and even when its busy, you get your food in a timely manner.  Love this place!

An excellent showing by a community based restaurant.  We shall start with the service.  It was good... bordering on excellent.  Ambiance was nice.  Food was excellent and plentiful. The voodoo sauce mixed with blue cheese added depth and fantastic sneak up on you heat. The large fry fed 3 people with left overs. All in all a solid good meal.  I will return.

Received attentive, if not nervous like, service and serving classically good Barney's Burgers  food. 
Perhaps it was the layout, the old athmosphere, the overly strong clinging perfume smell or the sticky feeling on the table but I cannot see myself returning to this particular Barney's on Solano.
So very good.  Best burger joint in the bay area

Barney's makes some of the best burgers I've had. Consistently. It's hard to describe exactly what they do so right, except that they capture the essence of an American burger. The classic Barney's Burger is big, juicy, slightly blackened, with fresh lettuce, tomato, and onion, on a perfect sesame bun. It's not edgy and over the top like a $25 artisanal gastropub burger. It's just damned good, and I keep coming back.

By Far the best place for pizza in Berkeley - Their pizzas are vegetarian (vegan option is also available). one option - listed on the black board as pizza of the day. Salad is also extremely tasty - must try. There is a store attached to this place - I definitely recommend to visit and get their green sauce and for those who want to eat their pizza later - there is a par-baked pizza for takeaway too. 5 stars

Fast service, like a pizza and salad factory. Service was excellent. Typical lunch HR rush for a popular place like this. One pizza can be served to 3-4 people with medium appetite. They only serve one pizza type for the day. So choose your day wisely!:-)

Be prepared to have your mind boggled.   There are SO many kinds of cheeses, that you get to taste before you purchase.  The variation in one kind of cheese can be astounding.  The olives are in abundance and super yummy.  From brine to oil cured, green or black, excellent selections.   Their bakery is amazing, you must try their baguette, sticky morning buns, the rye bread, nothing will let you down.  And, the pizza is a must!  The daily selections are based of seasonal creative choices that you don't find anywhere else.  This is a Berkeley Gourmet Ghetto Gem!

Cheeseboard is a Berkeley must have if you are in town. On weekends they have live music. Do not let the line scare you off. It goes by relatively fast. Be sure to check out the menu ahead of time as they only serve one pizza for the day.

Always great pizzas! Vegetarian, cooked fresh, co-op set up, frequently live music and a band! A great go to for pizza, drinks, and even salads! There's almost always a line but it moves quickly, buy pizza by the slice, half, or whole pizza, bonus slices thrown on top! There are gluten free options as well. See the pizza of the day online or the menu at the door.

First time in...got the plain toasted with low fat cream cheese. The cream cheese had an amazing flavor-one I have never had before. I also got two chicken kabobs for my daughters. They loved the intensity of the flavor. 
Support your local small business!!
Delicious bagel shop! Definitely the best around. Handmade bagels, good service, locally/family owned. #local
Friendly staff, fair prices, and GREAT bagels.  I love the asiago bagels, if you get there in the morning they're still warm.
Reasonable prices with good selection at a good quality. Their cookies are extremely delicious!
Friendly neighborhood spot, great selection and prices---I'm a regular on the weekends
Love it. Good food and great service. My family go there every weekends and they remember what we order. Quick and easy.

The fish tandoori is the best seafood I've had in the bay area. The other items on the menu were also delicious (in particular the various nan breads), all for super cheat. There's no catch. The venue is nice as are the people working there.
Great food reasonably priced. . Owner has poor etiquette bad service from him.
One of the best places you can eat at. The food is great and the service is wonderful. The prices are also good. 12/10 would recommend.

We’ve been going to this place for more than 20 years!  Best tandoori fish in the entire Bay Area!!!! The meat dishes are the best!!! We were there yesterday and of course enjoyed every bite! Really like this place👍🏻👍🏻

Lots of favorites here, and I've never had less than a very good meal. I worked down the street for a while, and kept returning to the tortilla soup, enchiladas, and various tacos. The seasonal specials are often awesome, too--i usually loved the tamales.
Good food! Wish I would have ordered more food..the chips and guacamole looked great!
Oohh, I would eat here every day if I could. Drinks and bartenders also top shelf. Everything tastes like it was just made fresh for you!

My favorite local restaurant and where we bring all our guests. The new larger space is painted in cheerful, bright colors and is full of the busy, happy noisiness of a popular restaurant full of happy people enjoying amazing food. I'm unsure if I like the ambiance or the food better. My favorite is my normal Mexican or TexMex restaurant order: chicken enchiladas with Verde sauce.

Since they moved to the new location, the place has gone downhill. Since they take order so close to the door, you are almost always waiting in line outside in the cold. Not ideal during winter. Most importantly, they seem to be focused more on their new bar. The quality of food has gone downhill. We ordered tortilla soup. There was no soup but bunch of beans and one piece of sad looking avocado. We ordered rice and beans for our kids as we have done for the last 5 years, the rice was hard and beans were tasteless. Super sad about the food quality.

The food is delicious and consistently fresh. Make room for an appetizer and save room for dessert. You will want to try everything! You can't go wrong with the baby back ribs, the fried chicken, and  the Voodoo Shrimp. And the house cocktails are tasty, too! Get there early tho and stay away from the popular rush times.

The best! Once a month I crave their appetizer spare ribs. A portion big enough for dinner w enough left over for takeout. Also shrimp and grits are great and ambience. Prices have gone up but hey this is Berkeley. Rents on Shattuck are high.

Great service. I ordered the buttermilk fried chicken. Baby back ribs. Jambalaya. Sausage.and hush puppies. They all were delicious. The only thing I didn't like was the potatoes that came with the ribs. Everything else was well worth it. I highly recommend

I often take work clients who are visiting our office here.  I think the food is delicious and well worth the price.  I recommend the hush puppies as an appetizer and the fried chicken for an entree.  If you have room for dessert try the pecan pie.
Always a great dinner. Nice wine choices and  wonderful food. My girlfriend and I usually just order 3-4 appetizers to try out a bit of everything. Nice entrees as well!

I was dining alone so I chose to sit at the sushi bar. The chefs as well as the wait staff were extremely friendly and efficient. The sushi was among the highest quality I've had. There is free parking across the street which is a significant bonus in Berkeley. Highly recommended!

Amazing Japanese food and hospitality was top notch. Price was fair as per the quality and the service they are delivering. Staff was kind and friendly. You have to wait usually here as they are always full or crowded. But overall it was nice dining experience here and not only me but my family also like this place.

This place is amazing.  Yes, it's pricier than other favorite Japanese places,  but the food is great.  Service is great.  The owners are kind and remembered me! To those that have never been: for dinner, it is loud, it is crowded, and it can get crazy! Come before they open and get in line or expect to wait.
Get here early as they don't take reservations! But always great food, amazing staff, and quality ingredients. The eggplant is to die for.

Don't bother with cut rate sushi... Kirala is pricier for a reason - it is GOOD.
Sushi should not be messed with. There's salmonella. E.coli. Listeria. And, dear god, vibrio. So don't play Russian roulette with your dinner. Just pay the money. Go somewhere that knows how to do this, because they've been doing it for a couple of generations now. So clean, fresh, and delicious. I love it every time. One star off because they were out of 3 things we tried to order, and that just shouldn't happen.

Amazing food, the wait is always wrong and servers will always be rushing. Not the best service but for a college student neighborhood it's pretty decent. The Bread and the Omelate was amazing, the biscuit needed the jelly but the Home fries was a great add on. Decent price for the size, more paying for the looks. Food looks exactly like the pictures.

I requested a two-top on the bench (that had previously been a two-top; I watched the previous couple leave and the table get cleaned). I was told by the host to basically shrug off/he was managing his tables, and that, as a caveat, he might ask us to "move" if a 6 top came in. I'm sorry but, excuse me? No. I've worked in restaurants on and off for 15 years and never once said something like that to someone. The tables are so close to each other that you feel like your shoulders are about to graze the people next to you; consider removing even just one two-top and everyone - your customers and your staff - will be a lot more relaxed. What we ordered was bland/under-salted and/or weirdly-seasoned (way too much nutmeg in the biscuits and gravy), and we left paying $50 for an offensive and underwhelming experience.
Food was really tasty. Being a vegan, I always wonder about restaurants and how they address my needs but this one nailed it.
This place is always busy for a reason . They do an excellent job at working the very small space they have. Amazing food and they make their own biscuits.  A true Farm house style breakfast.
The best place to eat breakfast in Berkeley. I love it.

Update: Cha Am has closed! Real bummer. This was the best. Location is now an Indian  food place. Haven't tried it yet.

Original review:  We've been going to Cha Am for over 25 years and the quality of the food and service has been consistently the best. The silver noodle salad is amazing, and green curry is my favorite. 
Parking can be difficult at peak times, don't try the Andronicos lot, they ticket, and the front steps are a challenge. Recently the prices rose a bit, but still worth it.
Great food. Never had a bad dish. Staff is awesome!!  We closed the place down and they just kept telling us "no hurry, take your time".   Wonderful people

We really enjoyed out meal at Cha Am.  I had the BBQ ribs and my wife had pineapple/shrimp friend rice.  Both were delicious and the presentation was exceptional.  It does have a charming rustic feel.  Recommend it!
I've been going to this place for years now and I've always had a good experience. Good staff and good food in a good location and good prices. That's a lot of good!
VERY accommodating for gluten-free needs!  Great selection, and the seafood is very fresh.  I love the window-box seats.
Absolutely delicious food, attractive decor, and very gracious and attentive service. My first time here but definitely not the last! I can't wait to go back...

If you are looking for a low-sodium Southern Asian curry, this is the place. Not sure if it's intentional but the food, mainly curries, taste less salty than any other curries I have ever tried. It's not that it's not good, I can still taste other spice in the curry and it's still delicious, but just surprised that the sodium content seems lower than usual, which is definitely a good thing!
This place has such a warm vibe of home Nepal. All the food ware tasty. Momos are great too. Our host was funny and cute.
Very tasty! Cooked just the way you like it. Great flavor and generous portions.
sweet little spot. excellent food & service.  himalayan is a little milder than indian counterpart, but still full of flavor.  try unusual specials!

Kirin is wonderful! They have a great bar, great food, and a fun atmosphere. 

Our favorite things are the soup dumplings, the Manchurian beef (it's crispy and delicious), and the sizzling rice soup. 

We actually ended up having our rehearsal dinner there for our wedding. They have a great private dining room in the back. This place is really well priced. Highly recommend.
Has dinner last night. It was excellent. This place has the best Chinese food in town by far.

We’ve been multiple times and never had anything bad. The chefs are creative and careful and it shows! Excellent, fresh ingredients and interesting dishes. The boa is addictive, the sauces and spices are stunning. Well worth the price!
I go for the spicy green beans and the garlic eggplant.  Atmosphere is sleek and modern

Superb as always, although almost want to take off a star for prices, but it's such high quality ingredients it's really hard to. I always get the same thing, the hot and sour soup, loaded with protein ingredients, a cut above every other chinese restaurant I've ever been to, although this last visit had less of the hot and sour flavor I crave so much from here. But wow so filling and tasty, packed with ingredients. Ice tea was great too!

I love Vanessa's! Creative cocktails, with inventive Asian-French fusion dishes. Great portions, for reasonable prices. If you are looking for a more upscale-feeling date spot, without the huge price tag, Vanessa's is perfect.
Fusion food does not have a big draw now. But tasting vietnamese food with French flavors is magic not fusion.
I've been a guest since they opened. Great food, great people (the owners,  staff and their huge collection of regulars). Always eager to visit.

Delicious creative wonderful food.
Highly recommend this restaurant.
Great Happy Hour every day.
This restaurant has lost its mojo. Way to noisy, made worse by the tv blaring. Pot stickers hard and old. Shrimp roll old and tough. Same with their pecan pie. Cold and drafty.

I love Ici ice cream! I've been going here since I was a kid and it's hands down my favorite ice cream place. A bit pricier, but it's well worth it. I love trying their new and interesting flavors, but the chocolate ice cream with a waffle cone is my go-to. It's the best! Also you can walk down the street just a few shops over to My Basic Bird and look at the kittens in the window while eating your ice cream. It's a great experience. I've never had a bad time.

Berkeley is home to two Ici locations and University Ave is closer to home. But for some reason I feel more at ease at this location because there's no homeless issues let alone panhandling. I don't have anything against those folks, but I rather drive a little further knowing I can take my time without compromising safely. Both shop is small, but this one has bench like seating with back against window. Tonight after dinner nearby I wanted ice cream without going far. Ici was just five minutes away so I went. I look around thinking same flavors as usual so I asked. Worker informed me that they've seasonal-peppermint, egg, pumpkin horchata and house-made gingersnap cone. No doubt I went with seasonal flavors on gingersnap cone. Refreshing, cold and sweet on both flavor. I like pink peppermint better than pumpkin horchata. Cone has ginger taste held up good no sogginess as brittleness as it can be even when ice cream melted.
Fancy flavors for a fair price. Usually a 20min wait because visitors can taste flavors for free. Be patient
Incredibly sad to hear the best ice cream in the bay area has closed. The area is so competitive that even some of the most talented and best places close

Ici is a Berkeley staple when it comes to high quality/ fancy ice cream. There's always an interesting selection of unique ice cream flavors, so there's something for everyone here. Ici is constantly changing the lineup of flavors, so make sure to try anything that looks interesting, you never know what will pop up as your new favorite! 

Ici is fairly far from the Berkeley campus, but the distance can actually be a nice way to destress and take some time away from campus to clear your thoughts. It also provides a nice opportunity to check out other restaurants in the Elmwood area. Finally, the other thing Ici is famous for is its long lines... because it's such a popular establishment, be prepared to wait for a while to get your ice cream.

I thought the food was only okay - got a burger and my husband got some grilled cheese sandwich. The atmosphere is definitely unique, but probably not enough for us to come back. The milkshake was delicious though.

This place is a local gem! It's built out in a 100 year old house with many original features preserved, and the food reflects the attention to detail French cuisine is famous for.

I always take out of town guests here for breakfast.
Ambiance was nice amd cozy. The spaghetti was good but the ribeye steak was too fatty and had a lot of ligaments. The french onion soup was very good.
Love the French onion soup and super service. Thank you!
The Bateau Ivre is as close to an old European coffee house as you’ll find in the Bay Area. It’s one-of-a-kind and a lovely place to read a good book over excellent coffee.

This place is a diamond in the rough. A true blue breakfast joint with personality to spare. 

Recommendations 
-Carolina Cheese Grits
-Breakfast
-Chicken and Waffles 

I’ve only been here on Saturday. If you want to avoid a line or wait get there before 8:45am. Otherwise be prepared to wait... for the best breakfast ever.
Fantastic tofu scramble! Moroccan inspired flavors with olives, tomatoes, and mint. It doesn't try to replace eggs and shines for it's own merit.

Outstanding in every aspect. The food us tremendous, the service is as good as it gets and did I mentioned THE FOOD!!! I have consisted this place three times and it has always been top notch.  If I had to find a complaint, it would be ...... why isn't this place in my home town?!?!?!?! 

This is a must visit if you are in this area
Delicious  locally sourced and sustainable ingredients.  Nice staff. Reasonable prices. Busy at weekends.

I love this place. I want my last me on this planet to be from here. Their Carolina cheese  grits are sinful. Literally sinful. I can not even tell you what I think about when I am eating them but believe me its.....  anyway always busy. From opening to closing be prepared to wait. It will be worth it. This restaurant is so  cool my daughter had a butterfly rest on her fingers during our entire meal. That's is how amazing this place is.

Great fresh seasonal specials and regular items. I am especially fond of the meatloaf and mashed potatoes - they do not make it on weekends, tho. And the key lime pie. They're best known for their breakfasts, but lunch dishes are also excellent.

Outstanding as always, no matter what you order. I've been going to this spot for years. Crowded, loud, diverse and old school. Happy Days-ish with a hints of Oktoberfest. Worth the wait on weekends. Enjoy.
Best. pancakes. ever. The long wait is totally worth it. Put your souffle order in early (before being seated) and experience taste bud nirvana.
Nice place for breakfast. Good price and good food. Get there early if you don't want to wait for too long

Really great diner in Berkeley! The pancakes are like edible delicious pillows, and I almost always go for the pancake special. The lemon ricotta pancakes are the best. The atmosphere is very crowded diner, so it's up to you if that sounds good. The giant suspended pie slice above the entrance is part of the experience. The waits can be pretty long on the weekend, but head down to Artis for a coffee while you wait!

Location: Located on San Pablo in West Berkeley, it is a Conveniently located with a parking space. There's also plenty of street parking.

Wait times: we went on a rainy day and it was not too busy, but on a sunny day it's usually pretty busy during weekend peak lunch/brunch hours and you might even have to wait if you want a spot on the outside.

Ambience: pretty cozy but not too loud. There's indoor and outdoor seating areas. I prefer the outdoor one more. It's just beautiful. People do come here to work as in a cafe, but not all tables are available for that. Some tables are reserved specifically for patrons wanting to have a proper dining experience.

Service: you pretty much order at the counter and then grab a table. You need to pick up your drinks/desserts on your way to the table. The food gets served at your table. Even though we came in on a lunch hour on a not so busy day, it did take some time for our food to arrive. But all the staff is pretty friendly and polite.

Food: The food was overall good. The mango smoothie not so much. The teas from there tea bar are highly recommended. Of all the things we ordered, I'd recommend the Chicken Tayeb and the Chicken Schnitzel Sandwich. I did however have moth eggs on a spinach leaf in my salad. Since I noticed it at the very end, I did not bother complaining, but the kitchen needs to pay more attention to cleaning the salad a bit more. 

Overall it was a positive experience. 4 stars.
Moderately high prices, great food and big portions. Cssual indoor and outdoor seating. Relatively easy parking.
The food is amazing! I loved the back patio. It's a cute garden seating
This place has an incredible selection of teas and a huge, beautiful back patio. Super chill Berkeley vibes.

Cafe Leila is one of my favorite places in Berkeley. If you walk outside looks like anyplace, but at the end there's a beautiful open space to have lunch. 
I usually ask just a smoothie or something fresh, but yesterday I wanna eat a properly breakfast. My favorite meal!
I chose "Alex morning" and my only complain is the coffee, because it wasn't good. It tasted bitter.
Anyway, the food was good and this place is really cozy.💞✨

I frequent this restaurant at least monthly.  Great for meeting friends and family. Staff is super friendly and attentive.  They food is always good. Especially the pork chop and the burgers. So tender and juicy!

What used to be Jimmy Beans is Lama Beans and nothing has changed here. The same delicious silver dollar pancakes, chorizo scramble (with the delicious sauces on the side) and unlimited strong coffee. After many years it was nice to come back to a local restaurant that has been around for a while.
Great Berkeley gem! Everything I have had on the menu is excellent! Great service.

Cute, small eatery w/outdoor seating in addition to the .. walk up order counter until 5pm.. Western style diner breakfast options: Eggs Benedict, French Toast, Chicken 'n' Waffles.. not overly crowded for 10am Sundau.. FAST Service.. will go back to try Mediterranean Lunch selections..
Tasty scrambles with salmon and crab. Good coffee and large amounts of fresh food and sauces.

Honest food at pretty decent prices - this little joint has limited hours and a fairly small menu, but what you'll get will definitely be memorable and will bring you back again. Simple fare - check their web site for hours and a picture of the specials menu board. 
Cash or check only.
Rib place has moved in. I had some tasty Hash during their weekend brunch today.

So many good things, hard to pick. I absolutely love their lunches. My faves are grilled salmon, grilled trout, steak sandwich with salsa verde, grilled chicken on organic greens with salsa verde. And, man oh man, the best hamburger anywhere...freshly ground daily. On a nice day, the back patio is fab.
Taste, tastey.  Favorites include salmon scramble and chorizo scramble.  The corned beef hash is great for carnivorous mornings--roar🐈 Come on down and also look at the Art🤗
Great find. Love the food love the owners. I look forward to going.

Every meal I’ve ever had at Zut! has been good. The menu isn’t too adventurous, and everything comes in reasonable portions. The staff is always friendly, and you never have to wait long at all. There is definitely something to be said for reliability!
Delicious food. Lovely service. Great place for long catch-up lunch w/a good friend!

Food/Drinks: Chipotle Chicken Pizza was good. 
Ordered a Burger before and was not satisfied with it, Medium Rare is not fully cooked to the center, telling me that’s how it’s made was not reassuring on the knowledge of food quality and control.
Ordered the same cocktail twice and got two different looking drinks each time, garnish set aside.

Service and experience: Call to confirm menu availability as it may vary through out the day. Waiters and management can’t be upfront with a consumers question or concerns. Dancing around a simple no is a bit insulting, but insisting we leave and go else where was rude.

The waiters are nice, if a bit slow, but that’s ok.  The atmosphere is amazing, the lighting is divine. The place is clean and gives off relaxing happy vibes.  The food is not that great, though, kind of a hit and miss. Stick to pizzas and greens, I guess. Anything that sounds even marginally fancy they don’t do well.

They probably need to find some new cooks.
beautiful restaurant and friendly customer service. the food was just delicious! very happy with my experience there ♡

My partner and I go out to Corso for special occasions. Corso's atmosphere is the right mix of cozy and elegant. The food is spectacular and filled with bold flavors. They also have an excellent selection of wines to pair with your entree. The staff is always friendly as well as informative and knowledgeable about the dishes on the menu. 

Corso is definitely the place to visit for a date night or a birthday dinner.

This is one of my go-to places in the East Bay. I've never had anything but incredible food here and service to match. It's a bit noisy due to the popularity and setting, but nothing terrible. Absolutely a must try.

Food was excellent (squid ink pasta), cocktail was delicious (lion cub), staff was attentive and knowledgeable (Alexis and Jorge).
Highly recommended.
Service and food exceed expectations.  Simply spectacular. Several meals here and each has been spectacular.

This is difficult because I avoid being overly critical of restaurants. I was really disappointed at Corso. I expected so much more. 
The one positive thing that I can say is that service was very good.
We ordered the anchovy app and the chicken liver pate. The anchovies were not special. As a matter of fact they appeared as ordinary canned anchovy. The liver "pate" was more of a liver saute. Piled on crostini the presentation was vulgar looking.
I ordered the Branzino my partner the pork cutlet. My fish had a lovely crisp skin but the meat was mushy. 
As I said. Disappointed.
Always have a great time. Great staff. Big tunes. Quality night out^^
Cool vibe, they play a lot of old school hip hop. $20 cover and $9 drinks. Crowd is like 25-40ish yrs old. Good time, would go there again!
Went to a really fun amateur burlesque competition here. Was in the back of the bar and they had a pretty good amount of seats and speedy bar service. Will be going back

This place sucks. The security guards use their power. I don't ever wait in lines especially in winter are you kidding me. We waited because it was our friends birthday and were notified by the security guys that even if we were on guest list we have to wait for 5-10 minites in line. After the wait in cold weather for 15 minutes we had to deal with the rudest security guard who flexed his powers.  I will never spent my money or go there ever. There so many other and better places in Toronto.

FYI
We did not bypass the line. And we did notify the security person that we are on guest list and waited in line as per their request. I do host large events in Toronto and am aware of how the venues work.. Also, profanity by your security is unexpectable.
I love this place, as a musician I've been on that state many times and it never gets old! Lovely crew!
